overview.summary: A full-stack Django e-commerce application built as a freelance-style upgrade of a ceramic artist’s portfolio site.
overview.problem: The original site functioned only as a static portfolio and lacked product management, payments, and client interaction features.
overview.solution: A complete Django-based e-commerce experience with product collections, Stripe Checkout integration, and an accessible, responsive front end.

responsibilities: Planned and implemented the full-stack architecture based on a simulated client brief
Built Django models for products, collections, and contact submissions
Integrated Stripe Checkout for secure payment processing in test mode
Developed accessible, responsive templates using Django and Tailwind CSS

architecture.approach: Modular Django application with clear separation between models, views, templates, and configuration, designed to reflect real-world freelance delivery.
architecture.data_flow: Product and collection data is managed through Django models and rendered via server-side templates; Stripe handles payment flow externally while order intent is managed internally.
architecture.deployment: Designed for local development and demonstration, with configuration ready for production deployment.

key_features: Stripe Checkout integration for real payment flows
Accessible, semantic HTML with responsive layouts
Contact form backed by Django models and email handling
challenges_and_learnings: Designing a clean Django architecture from a client-style brief
Balancing backend logic with front-end accessibility and UX
Making practical trade-offs common in freelance projects
future_improvements: Add persistent order history and user accounts
Replace SQLite with a production database
Deploy the application to a cloud hosting platform
